name: First Wednesday Night Free at the AGO
description:
Enjoy the galleries at night.

Please dress for the weather as the queue for entrance begins outside the AGO. Pack light as wait times for coat check may be longer than usual. Bags larger than a small purse, including backpacks and totes must be left at coat check for a fee. Please refrain from bringing oversized bags.

name: An Evening with Nicola Benedetti

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
The Grammy Award-winning Scottish violinist returns for another enthralling Koerner Hall concert, featuring works by Bloch, Ponce, Paganini, Sarasate, and others, along with new commissions and arrangements of traditional Scottish music.

Nicola Benedetti is one of the most sought-after violinists of her generation. Her ability to captivate audiences and her wide appeal as an advocate for classical music has made her one of the most influential artists of today. 

Winner of the Grammy Award for Best Classical Instrumental Solo in 2020, as well as Best Female Artist at both 2012 and 2013 Classical BRIT Awards, Benedetti's most recent recording features works written especially for her by jazz musician Wynton Marsalis: Violin Concerto in D Major and Fiddle Dance Suite for Solo Violin.

name: Indoor Farmers' Market at Montgomery's Inn
description: Gather at Montgomery's Inn for the Indoor Farmers' Market Season. Experience the best of local and farm fresh food, famous INNovator Bread, and family-friendly activities. All are welcome. The indoor market runs from February 4 - May 20 and then moves outdoors.

name: Active Winter Tree Tour at High Park
description:
Join us for an active tour at High Park. For those looking to primarily walk, but to stop occasionally to learn neat facts about the park and its ecology.

Note that active tours are outdoors for the entire tour duration. Please dress according to the weather to stay warm and prepare for uneven and slippery terrain. Tour distances will range from 1 â€“ 5 km. 

Space is limited. Please register in advance at nrm@toronto.ca to secure a spot to attend. Include the name of the park tour you would like to attend and number of attendees. Contact nrm@toronto.ca for information on site conditions, including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.
